dmca.title: Abuse report ref: NRID14101
dmca.body:
Please process this asap.
 
Thanks.

________________________________

From: Sebastian Taylor [mailto:sebt@nr-online.com] 
Posted At: Monday, November 27, 2006 4:39 AM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: Abuse report ref: NRID14101
Subject: FW: Abuse report ref: NRID14101



Dear Sirs,

     

     I have been informed by your abuse department that they are not
able to process email attachments in any format other than plain text.
Subsequently I must forward this email to yourselves in order to resolve
this most urgent of issues. Although the details will not become clear
until you have read the below email, the 3rd match in the cricket series
which is the subject of this copyright breach started today (27/11), and
so it makes this issue all the more urgent to solve.

 

The reference on the reply I received from the abuse department was
[EV1-C1879166I].

________________________________

From: Sebastian Taylor [mailto:sebt@nr-online.com] 
Sent: 20 November 2006 12:35
To: abuse@theplanet.com
Subject: Abuse report ref: NRID14101

 

Dear Sirs,

      I am writing from a UK based IP rights protection firm called
NetResult that is currently representing the US broadcaster Echostar LLC
concerning the current Pakistan vs. West Indies cricket series for which
they are the broadcasting rights owners. 

      We have recently sent to yourselves a Cease and Desist
notification (a copy of which may be found at the bottom of this email)
regarding the illegal streaming activities of your client site: 
http://www.cricketzero.com <http://www.cricketzero.com/>  . It has come
to our attention that, although the main page of this site now only
contains a "site under construction" message, an email has been received
by NetResult in an anonymous account which directs the user towards the
URL http://www.cricketzero.com/member/ . From this page, users can still
enter their login details and then proceed to the URL 
http://www.cricketzero.com/member/member.php in which one can still
purchase an illegal streaming package for the Pakistan vs West Indies
series. Obviously, you will most likely be unaware of this, as you will
not have been sent this same email, and the site will appear clean of
any infringements without this information.

    Below you will find a time and date stamped screenshot of the sites
current member page which clearly demonstrates that the site is
continuing its illegal activity - in the "Membership Type" box you can
clearly see that the Pakistan vs. West Indies series is still offered
for $25:



 

As this site is continuing to infringe on the rights of our client,
Echostar LLC, I must request that you remove it fully from your servers
in order to avoid pernicious liability for allowing it to continue to
violate our clients rights.

 

Please use the reference NRID14101 in any future correspondence
regarding this issue and inform me as soon as possible how you intend to
proceed on this matter.

 

Yours sincerely,

        Sebastian Taylor

 

NetResult

A Division of Projector NetResult Ltd

Mulberry House

583 Fulham Road

London

UK SW6 5UA

 

Tel: 0207 471 1733

 

Head Office: Projector NetResult Ltd, 8 Wye Street, Hereford, UK HR2 7RB

 

 

 

************************************************************************
****************Original Cease and Desist notification, sent
16/11/06****************************************************************
************

 

TITLE: Pakistan v West Indies Series 2006 infringments-
EchoStar_NRID14101

 

Echostar: Pakistan v West Indies Series 2006 infringments-
EchoStar_NRID14101

 

NetResult Internal Reference:  EchoStar_NRID14101

 

Please quote the above EchoStar_NRID14101 reference in all
communications with us regarding this issue.

 

 

 

Dear Sirs,

 

We write on behalf of EchoStar Satellite L.L.C. ("EchoStar") which owns
and/or controls broadcast rights in North America for Pakistan v West
Indies Series 2006.

 

We have noticed that your website, http://www.cricketzero.com
<http://www.cricketzero.com/>  is displaying, promoting and/or offering
A/V content from the Pakistan v West Indies Series 2006.

 

We wish to make you aware that your present, unauthorized display of
such A/V content is an infringement of EchoStar's exclusive intellectual
property rights under national and international copyright laws.  On
behalf of EchoStar, I hereby demand that you immediately cease all such
infringements on any and all web sites (and elsewhere) and confirm to
NetResult within two (2) business days of the date of this letter, via
return email, that you have done so.  Your failure to comply with this
demand will expose to you civil and criminal liability.  Govern yourself
accordingly. 

 

Nothing in this letter is intended or shall be construed to constitute
an express or implied waiver of any of EchoStar's rights or remedies,
all of which are expressly reserved.

 

Formal Declaration

 

I, Mike Kiernan, hereby state that EchoStar are the owners of the
exclusive rights to the A/V content referenced above and that NetResult
is authorized to act on EchoStar's behalf with respect to internet
monitoring and compliance related to infringement of such rights.

 

On behalf of EchoStar, I hereby state that I have a good faith belief
that use of such A/V content in the manner complained of is not
authorized by EchoStar, its agents, or the law.

 

I, Mike Kiernan, as a representative of NetResult hereby digitally sign
this e-mail message under penalty of perjury under the laws of the
United States of America with the additional statement under penalty of
perjury that the information in the notice is accurate.

 

We thank you for your timely and full cooperation.

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

Mike Kiernan

 

 

NetResult

A Division of Projector NetResult Ltd

Mulberry House

583 Fulham Road

London

UK SW6 5UA

 

Tel: 0207 471 1733

 

Head Office: Projector NetResult Ltd, 8 Wye Street, Hereford, UK HR2 7RB

 

Please note, if this email has been sent to the wrong recipient, please
accept our apologies, inform us of the error, and forward this e-mail
immediately to the correct person or department for action.
